kickstart.post: /sbin/chkconfig tgtd on /sbin/chkconfig iscsid on /sbin/chkconfig img-storage-nas on
/usr/bin/systemctl enable target /usr/bin/systemctl enable iscsid /usr/bin/systemctl enable img-storage-nas

mkdir /var/log/rocks
/opt/rocks/bin/rocks report host imgstorage &hostname;
#!/bin/bash # # while for the config file to be ready
while ! [ -f /opt/rocks/etc/rabbitmq.conf ] || ! [ -f /opt/rocks/etc/rabbitmq_img-storage.conf ] ; do sleep 1; done
/sbin/service img-storage-nas start
# we need this only the first boot after the installation # after that the file will be there rm /etc/rc.d/rocksconfig.d/post-55-restart-img-storage
ACTION=="add", KERNEL=="zfs", MODE="0660", GROUP="&imgstorage-group;"
#!/bin/bash # # while for the img-storage user to appear
while [ ! `id -u &imgstorage-user;` ];do sleep 5 done
# so udevd sees that there is not img-storage group at boot time # then it caches that value for the 91-zfs-permissions.rules # # to stop this behaviour we need to touch the file # so udev will reparse the rules and properly load the group # # 1 day of debugging to figure this out! touch /etc/udev/rules.d/91-zfs-permissions.rules /sbin/udevadm trigger --sysname-match=zfs
# we need this only the first boot after the installation # after that the file will be there rm /etc/rc.d/rocksconfig.d/post-50-restart-udev-zfs-perm
